cves.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6, macOS Sonoma 14.7.7, macOS Ventura 13.7.7. An app may be able to break out of its sandbox.
problemType: An app may be able to break out of its sandbox

cves.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 18.6 and iPadOS 18.6, watchOS 11.6, macOS Sequoia 15.6, tvOS 18.6, visionOS 2.6. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to memory corruption.
problemType: Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to memory corruption

cves.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 18.6 and iPadOS 18.6, watchOS 11.6, macOS Sequoia 15.6, tvOS 18.6, visionOS 2.6. Processing a maliciously crafted audio file may lead to memory corruption.
problemType: Processing a maliciously crafted audio file may lead to memory corruption

cves.description: This issue was addressed with improved validation of symlinks. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6, iPadOS 17.7.9, macOS Sonoma 14.7.7, macOS Ventura 13.7.7. An app may be able to access protected user data.
problemType: An app may be able to access protected user data

cves.description: A permissions issue was addressed with additional restrictions. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6, macOS Sonoma 14.7.7, macOS Ventura 13.7.7. An app may be able to read files outside of its sandbox.
problemType: An app may be able to read files outside of its sandbox

cves.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6. A download's origin may be incorrectly associated.
problemType: A download's origin may be incorrectly associated

cves.description: This issue was addressed through improved state management. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6, macOS Sonoma 14.7.7. An app may be able to gain root privileges.
problemType: An app may be able to gain root privileges

cves.description: An out-of-bounds access issue was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in visionOS 2.6, macOS Sequoia 15.6, iOS 18.6 and iPadOS 18.6, tvOS 18.6. Processing a maliciously crafted media file may lead to unexpected app termination or corrupt process memory.
problemType: Processing a maliciously crafted media file may lead to unexpected app termination or corrupt process memory

cves.description: An authorization issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6. A local attacker may gain access to Keychain items.
problemType: A local attacker may gain access to Keychain items

cves.description: An injection issue was addressed with improved validation. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6. An app may be able to access sensitive user data.
problemType: An app may be able to access sensitive user data

cves.description: This issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6, macOS Sonoma 14.7.7. An app may be able to access sensitive user data.
problemType: An app may be able to access sensitive user data

cves.description: A permissions issue was addressed with additional sandbox restrictions. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6. A sandboxed process may be able to circumvent sandbox restrictions.
problemType: A sandboxed process may be able to circumvent sandbox restrictions

cves.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 18.6 and iPadOS 18.6, watchOS 11.6, macOS Sequoia 15.6, tvOS 18.6, visionOS 2.6. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to memory corruption.
problemType: Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to memory corruption

cves.description: A logging issue was addressed with improved data redaction. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6, macOS Sonoma 14.7.7, iPadOS 17.7.9, macOS Ventura 13.7.7. An app may be able to access sensitive user data.
problemType: An app may be able to access sensitive user data

cves.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved restrictions. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6, macOS Sonoma 14.7.7. A malicious app may be able to gain root privileges.
problemType: A malicious app may be able to gain root privileges

cves.description: A logic issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in iOS 18.6 and iPadOS 18.6. Passcode may be read aloud by VoiceOver.
problemType: Passcode may be read aloud by VoiceOver

cves.description: This issue was addressed through improved state management. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to universal cross site scripting.
problemType: Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to universal cross site scripting

cves.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 18.6 and iPadOS 18.6, watchOS 11.6, macOS Sequoia 15.6, tvOS 18.6, visionOS 2.6. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to an unexpected Safari crash.
problemType: Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to an unexpected Safari crash

cves.description: This issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6, macOS Sonoma 14.7.7. A malicious app may be able to read kernel memory.
problemType: A malicious app may be able to read kernel memory

cves.description: A use-after-free issue was addressed by removing the vulnerable code. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6, iPadOS 17.7.9, macOS Sonoma 14.7.7, macOS Ventura 13.7.7. An attacker may be able to cause unexpected app termination.
problemType: An attacker may be able to cause unexpected app termination

cves.description: A permissions issue was addressed with additional restrictions. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6. A sandboxed process may be able to launch any installed app.
problemType: A sandboxed process may be able to launch any installed app

cves.description: A permissions issue was addressed with additional restrictions. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6, macOS Sonoma 14.7.7, macOS Ventura 13.7.7. An app may be able to modify protected parts of the file system.
problemType: An app may be able to modify protected parts of the file system

cves.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6, macOS Sonoma 14.7.7, macOS Ventura 13.7.7. An app may be able to cause a denial-of-service.
problemType: An app may be able to cause a denial-of-service

cves.description: A permissions issue was addressed with additional restrictions. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6, macOS Sonoma 14.7.7, iPadOS 17.7.9, macOS Ventura 13.7.7. An app may be able to fingerprint the user.
problemType: An app may be able to fingerprint the user

cves.description: An out-of-bounds access issue was addressed with improved bounds checking. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6, macOS Sonoma 14.7.7, macOS Ventura 13.7.7. Processing a maliciously crafted file may lead to unexpected app termination.
problemType: Processing a maliciously crafted file may lead to unexpected app termination

cves.description: An input validation issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6, tvOS 18.6, iOS 18.6 and iPadOS 18.6, visionOS 2.6. Processing a maliciously crafted file may lead to unexpected app termination.
problemType: Processing a maliciously crafted file may lead to unexpected app termination

cves.description: A configuration issue was addressed with additional restrictions. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6, macOS Sonoma 14.7.7. Account-driven User Enrollment may still be possible with Lockdown Mode turned on.
problemType: Account-driven User Enrollment may still be possible with Lockdown Mode turned on

cves.description: An out-of-bounds read was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6, macOS Sonoma 14.7.7, macOS Ventura 13.7.7. Processing a maliciously crafted file may lead to unexpected app termination.
problemType: Processing a maliciously crafted file may lead to unexpected app termination

cves.description: This issue was addressed by adding an additional prompt for user consent. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14.7.7, macOS Sequoia 15.4, macOS Ventura 13.7.7. A shortcut may be able to bypass sensitive Shortcuts app settings.
problemType: A shortcut may be able to bypass sensitive Shortcuts app settings

cves.description: The issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6. An app may be able to cause a denial-of-service.
problemType: An app may be able to cause a denial-of-service

cves.description: A privacy issue was addressed by removing the vulnerable code. This issue is fixed in macOS Sequoia 15.6. A sandboxed process may be able to circumvent sandbox restrictions.
problemType: A sandboxed process may be able to circumvent sandbox restrictions

cves.description: A denial-of-service issue was addressed with improved input validation. This issue is fixed in macOS Ventura 13.7.7, iPadOS 17.7.9, iOS 18.6 and iPadOS 18.6, macOS Sonoma 14.7.7, watchOS 11.6, macOS Sequoia 15.6, tvOS 18.6, visionOS 2.6. A non-privileged user may be able to modify restricted network settings.
problemType: A non-privileged user may be able to modify restricted network settings
